body.p: Many thanks for yours of the first giving an account of the disagreeable floods & other events at Heretaunga.
I had a conversation with Sir George Grey about a mission station and reserve for your purposes towards which he seems very favorably disposed.

Dr Sinclair often enquires for you and requested to be remembered to you when I should see you. Mr. Cole is shortly to be married to a widow lady lately arrived in the Colony. If all is well tomorrow I intend to get married myself to Miss Strang of this place, a young lady for whom I have for some time had an attachment. I hope that you will now consider my house your home when you visit Wellington.
I regret exceedingly to hear that Mrs Colenso is not very well. With kind respects to her and love to Fanny & Rati I am
I am not sure but I think I must leave for Ahuriri about the end of Septr.
